answers.answer: I know you say you've been to a lot of drs but have you been seen by an ENT?So sorry you are having so many issues and not getting answers.  I hope you get more feedback here.
Some clinics are doing the ultrasound guided ethanol injection into the nodule causing it to shrink.

Hi,Thanks for responding.  Yes, I have seen an ENT & Allergist.The ENT said allergies may be the cause of my throat swelling, so then I went to an allergist, who discovered the enlarged thyroid from routine check up, and made an appointment for ct scan/ultrasound, and prescribed me Zyrtec for allergies.
Thanks for the suggestion.  This is so hard for me, because I'm not recieving any treatment for my symptoms.  But I will talk to my surgeon about Ethanol injection.Thanks

Hum.The most striking of the symptoms you describe is significant weight loss.  That's definitely a sign something's going on in the throat and interferring with being able to take care of yourself properly.I do hope you get more responses.

Hi,I had talked to my endocronologist about my weight loss, and he say's that's great news !!  Losing weight is always a good thing, he looks at the computer and say's you have been gradually losing weight, but not at a rapid speed, diabetes can cause this.I tested for diabetes, I am not diabetic.I used to be 270 pounds atheletic build,  worked out on my threadmill walking 5 miles a day.  Now I'm around 180 pounds, hardly any muscles, and no energy.  Doctors don't take me seriously.  Reason I am always disappointed, stressed & frustrated.Thanks for your feedback.

I once read an experience of someone who had the thyroid removed, not because it wasn't functioning okay but because it was obstructing and interferring with the person's eating and weight.  Your symptom is similar.  I would continously stress that to each dr you see.  I do hope that's not many more.

question: Hi,I'm exhausted !!  I am a 45 year old male, with an enlarged thryoid and mass measuring 5.5 x 3.3.  Biopsy done Sept 07 found no cancer.  All my symptoms point towards hypothyroid, bad body temp fluctuations, super exhausted, very slow heart rate 50-52 bpm, super dry scalp, dry chapping skin, chronic dandruff, muscle aches & pains, I've lost 82 pounds, no exercise, from hardly being able to eat, from swollen throat.My endo always tells me, my thyroid tests are all normal, and once borderline 3.0,.  Antibody test normal.  I am not diabetic, I am so frustrated, feeling so miserable everyday, and all my test show normal, while my symptoms are killing me.I am exhausted everyday, I only get out of bed 1-2 hour per day, the rest of the time, I lay in bed from weakness, for months.I have gone to the ER numerous times, primary doc, endo, oncology, surgeon, allergist, cardiologist, and nothing is ever found in the past 1.5 years, all test results are normal, this is driving me crazy,  because I know there is something wrong.  I've called the National hotline, desperate for help, no help was available.  I spoke with a psychiatrist, keeping me calm from stressing out.No one is taking my condition seriously, I don't know what else to do, but just lay here and die.  I live alone with no family or friends locally.I try to post a question to a doctor, but questions always exceeds limit.I am too tired to even get lab results to post on Medhelp, I have to take a taxi for appointments out of town, stay in a hotel overnight.I just don't undertand why my symptoms & conditions are not taken seriously.  All the obvious signs are there.  I pleaded with my doctor, to keep me in the hospital, and she tells me there is no rooms available.The surgeon doesn't want to remove my thyroid because it is functionting normally, although is sits right over my throat, making an indention towards my airway, my throat whistles while I breathe, the swelling protrudes from my neck, my airway is shaped like a C on X-ray.Please, I need help, someone please help me.  Who can I contact that will take my condition seriously, is there a doctor online, I can communicate with, a doctor I can call, a nurse, anyone in the field of thyroid studies, I live in Central Texas.I have posted questions to the thyroid forum, and majority of my questions do not get a response.  I don't know how to communicate on the forum.  Or what needs to be done to recieve assistance.  I just feel so alone and suffering.Thank you for taking the time to read.
title: Desperate for help
